brother.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a male who has the same parents as you
brother.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I have two brothers, William and Mark.
My big brother (=older brother) has always looked after me.
My younger brother is a doctor.
I have to take my little brother to school.
brother.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a word meaning a black man, used especially by other black men
brother.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a male member of a group with the same interests, religion, profession etc as you
brother.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a male member of a religious group, especially a monk
brother.translation[0].definitions[4].de: a member of a fraternity (=a club of male university students)
brother.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: Jake was my big brother and I admired him.
Do you have any younger brothers?
My kid brother was always annoying me.
Mum let me hold my new baby brother.
Luke and his twin brother Sam went everywhere together.
I never really liked my half-brother.
His dad’s new wife brought him two step-brothers.
brother.translation[1].definitions[0].de: used to show you are annoyed or surprised
brother.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Oh, brother – I really don’t want to deal with this now.
